009
010package imagingbook.pub.regions;
011
012import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020
021/**
022 * This class represents a closed contour as a sequence of
023 * pixel coordinates. It implements the {@link Comparable}
024 * interface for sorting contours by length.
025 * It supports iteration over the points along the contour, 
026 * e.g., by
027 * <pre>
028 * Contour C = ...;
029 * for (Point p : C) {
030 *    // process p ...
031 * }
032 * </pre>
033 * 
034 * @version 2020/12/21
035 */
036public class Contour implements Comparable<Contour>, Iterable<Pnt2d> {
037        
038        static private int INITIAL_SIZE = 50;
039        
040        private final int label;
041        private final List<Pnt2d> points;
042        
043        /**
044         * Creates a new (empty) contour with the given region label.
045         * @param label the region label for this contour.
046         */
047        public Contour (int label) {
048                this.label = label;
049                points = new ArrayList<Pnt2d>(INITIAL_SIZE);
050        }
051        
052        public void addPoint (Pnt2d p) {
053                points.add(p);
054        }
055        
056        //--------------------- retrieve contour points -------
057        
058        /**
059         * Get the list of contour points.
060         * @return a reference to the internal list of contour points.
061         */
062        public List<Pnt2d> getPointList() {
063                return points;
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Get the contour points as an array.
068         * @return a new array of contour points.
069         */
070        public Pnt2d[] getPointArray() {
071                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
072        }
073                
074        //--------------------- contour statistics ------------
075        
076        /**
077         * Get the length of the contour.
078         * @return the number of points on the contour.
079         */
080        public int getLength() {
081                return points.size();
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Get the region label associated with this contour.
086         * @return the region label of the contour.
087         */
088        public int getLabel() {
089                return label;
090        }
091        
092        //--------------------- debug methods ------------------
093        
094        @Override
095        public String toString(){
096                return
097                        "Contour " + label + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Get the polygon for this contour (for subsequent drawing).
102         * @return the polygon.
103         */
104        public Path2D getPolygonPath() {
105                return getPolygonPath(0.5, 0.5);        // offset by 0.5 to pass through pixel centers
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * Get the polygon for this contour (for subsequent drawing).
110         * An offset can be specified for shifting the contour positions
111         * at pixel centers (set to 0.5/0.5).
112         * 
113         * @param xOffset the horizontal offset.
114         * @param yOffset the vertical offset.
115         * @return a polygon.
116         */
117        public Path2D getPolygonPath(double xOffset, double yOffset) {
118                Path2D path = new Path2D.Float();
119                Pnt2d[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
120                if (pnts.length > 1){
121                        path.moveTo(pnts[0].getX() + xOffset, pnts[0].getY() + yOffset);
122                        for (int i = 1; i < pnts.length; i++) {
123                                path.lineTo(pnts[i].getX() + xOffset,  pnts[i].getY() + yOffset);
124                        }
125                        path.closePath();
126                }
127                else {  // mark single pixel region "X"
128                        double x = pnts[0].getX();
129                        double y = pnts[0].getY();
130                        path.moveTo(x + xOffset - 0.5, y + yOffset - 0.5);
131                        path.lineTo(x + xOffset + 0.5, y + yOffset + 0.5);
132                        path.moveTo(x + xOffset - 0.5, y + yOffset + 0.5);
133                        path.lineTo(x + xOffset + 0.5, y + yOffset - 0.5);
134                }
135                return path;
136        }
137        
138        /**
139         * Returns the number of successive duplicates in this contour.
140         * The result should be zero.
141         * @return as described.
142         */
143        public int countDuplicatePoints() {
144                Pnt2d[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
145                if (pnts.length <= 1) {
146                        return 0;
147                }
148                int cnt = 0;
149                for (int i = 0; i < pnts.length; i++) {
150                        int j = (i + 1) % pnts.length;
151                        if (pnts[i].getX() == pnts[j].getX() && pnts[i].getY() == pnts[j].getY()) {
152                                cnt++;
153                        }
154                }
155                return cnt;
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Checks if this contour is closed w.r.t. the specified
160         * {@link NeighborhoodType2D}, i.e., if the last and the first
161         * contour point are "connected".
162         * 
163         * @param nht the (@link NeighborhoodType}.
164         * @return true if the contour is closed.
165         */
166        public boolean isClosed(NeighborhoodType2D nht) {
167                Pnt2d[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
168                if (pnts.length < 2) 
169                        return true;
170                Pnt2d p1 = pnts[pnts.length - 1];
171                Pnt2d p2 = pnts[0];
172                double d2 = p1.distanceSq(p2);  // N4: max 1, N8: max 2
173                //System.out.println(nht + " dist=" + d2);
174                
175                if (nht == NeighborhoodType2D.N4 && d2 <= 1)
176                        return true;
177                if (nht == NeighborhoodType2D.N8 && d2 <= 2)
178                        return true;
179                return false;
180        }
181
182                
183        // Compare method for sorting contours by length (longer contours at front)
184        @Override
185        public int compareTo(Contour other) {
186                //return other.points.size() - this.points.size();
187                return Integer.compare(other.points.size(), this.points.size());
188        }
189
190        @Override
191        public Iterator<Pnt2d> iterator() {
192                return points.iterator();
193        }
194        
195        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
196        
197        public static class Outer extends Contour {
198                public Outer(int label) {
199                        super(label);
200                }
201                
202                @Override
203                public String toString(){
204                        return
205                                "Contour.Outer " + this.getLabel() + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
206                }
207        }
208        
209        public static class Inner extends Contour {
210                public Inner(int label) {
211                        super(label);
212                }
213                
214                @Override
215                public String toString(){
216                        return
217                                "Contour.Inner " + this.getLabel() + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
218                }
219        }
220        
221
222}
